p: Myrtaceae is a family of plants found in the Cerrado (savannah biome), which provides products that are used for both alimentary and medicinal purposes. Eugenia dysenterica DC (synon. Stenocalyx dysentericus Berg., Myrtus dysenterica M.), popularly known as “cagaita” or “cagaiteira”, is one important species of this family. According to traditional knowledge, cagaita leaves have anti-diarrheal properties and are also useful for treating diabetes [ 4]. Moreover, the cagaita fruit has been used in various preparations such as jams, ice-cream, liqueurs, and juices as it provides a source of bioactive nutritional compounds. Several macro and microelements such as vitamins, folates, carotenoids, and phenolic compounds have been identified in the pulp, providing both nutritional and economic benefits [ 5].
